qas.question: Why did Hutchins eliminate hospitals from the university?
In what year did Hutchins propose a plan to combine the U of C with Common Core?
During who's tenure was the University of Chicago Hospitals system destroyed?

context: In <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><b5_0>1929<b5_0/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, the university's fifth president, <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><b9_0>Robert Maynard Hutchins<b9_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, took office; the university underwent <b6_0>many changes<b6_0/> during his <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3>24-year<a2_3/><a2_1/> tenure<a2_0/>.<a2_2/> Hutchins eliminated varsity football from the university in <a3_2>an <b7_0>attempt <a3_0><a3_3>to <a3_1>emphasize academics<a3_1/> over athletics<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_0/>,<a3_3/> instituted the undergraduate college's liberal-arts curriculum known as <a4_0>the <a4_1><a4_2><a4_3>Common Core<a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>, and organized the university's graduate work into its current[when?] four divisions. In <b8_0>1933<b8_0/>, Hutchins proposed an unsuccessful plan to merge the University of Chicago and Northwestern University into a single university. During his term, the University of Chicago Hospitals (now called the University of Chicago Medical Center) finished construction and enrolled its first medical students. Also, the Committee on Social Thought, an institution distinctive of the university, was created.
